docs.description: Adds a lookup relation or 'dome insert' to a record.

tags.title: example
tags.description:
Data Sourced Value:
 relationship("relationship_name__r", "externalID on related object", dataSource("path"))
Fixed Value:
 relationship("relationship_name__r", "externalID on related object", "hello world")

docs.description:
Execute an SOQL query.
Note that in an event of a query error,
error logs will be printed but the operation will not throw the error.

The Salesforce query API is subject to rate limits, {@link https://sforce.co/3W9zyaQ See for more details}.

tags.title: example
tags.description: query(state=> `SELECT Id FROM Patient__c WHERE Health_ID__c = '${state.data.field1}'`);

tags.title: example
tags.description: query(state=> `SELECT Id FROM Patient__c WHERE Health_ID__c = '${state.data.field1}'`, { autoFetch: true });
tags.caption: Query more records if next records are available

tags.title: param
tags.description: A query string. Must be less than `4000` characters in WHERE clause
tags.name: qs

tags.title: param
tags.description: Options passed to the bulk api.
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: A callback to execute once the record is retrieved
tags.name: callback

docs.description:
Execute an SOQL Bulk Query.
This function uses bulk query to efficiently query large data sets and reduce the number of API requests.
`bulkQuery()` uses {@link https://sforce.co/4azgczz Bulk API v.2.0 Query} which is available in API version 47.0 and later.
This API is subject to {@link https://sforce.co/4b6kn6z rate limits}.

tags.title: example
tags.description: bulkQuery(state=> `SELECT Id FROM Patient__c WHERE Health_ID__c = '${state.data.field1}'`);
tags.caption: The results will be available on `state.data`

tags.title: example
param
tags.description: Options passed to the bulk api.
tags.name: options

tags.title: param
tags.description: A callback to execute once the record is retrieved
tags.name: callback

docs.description:
Picks out a single value from a JSON object.
If a JSONPath returns more than one value for the reference, the first
item will be returned.

tags.title: param
tags.description: JSONPath referencing a point in given JSON object.
tags.name: path

docs.description:
Picks out a single value from source data.
If a JSONPath returns more than one value for the reference, the first
item will be returned.

Picks out a value from source data.
Will return whatever JSONPath returns, which will always be an array.
If you need a single value use `sourceValue` instead.
Ensures a path points at the data.

Picks out a single value from the source data object—usually `state.data`.
If a JSONPath returns more than one value for the reference, the first
item will be returned.
Ensures a path points at references.
Picks out the last reference value from source data.

Scopes an array of data based on a JSONPath.
Useful when the source data has `n` items you would like to map to
an operation.
The operation will receive a slice of the data based of each item
of the JSONPath provided.

It also ensures the results of an operation make their way back into
the state's references.

tags.title: param
tags.description: The operation needed to be repeated.
tags.name: operation
